The Sour Side Of Sugar 6 years ago in Conceptual

More Like This

Atomic Bomb Affects on JapanThe first atomic bomb used in warfare, was dropped on Hiroshima Japan, on August 6th 1945 (Morton 515). The plane that dropped the first atomic bomb on Japan was the B-29 Enola Gay, and the dropping of the atomic bomb would save thousands of lives (Alperovitz 1). The atomic bomb had affects in the United States, the development helped to introduce Fluorine into public water supply. There were also rumors of how atomic bomb could change weather patterns in an area. However, dropping atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki had a great amount of physical and psychological affects on the people of Japan. Fluoride There have been several medical issues linked to the atomic bomb. During the development of the atomic bomb, the chemical element Fluorine was key. Fluoride is now introduced into the water of America and there is still controversy about if fluoride is safe or not (Griffiths and Bryson 1). Massive quantities of fluoride- millions of tons- were essential for the manufacture ofAtomic Bomb Affects on Japan6 years ago in Academic Essays
